tasks: Study set systems formed by neighborhoods in graphs of bounded twin-width
methods: Direct combinatorial proof of distality in ordered graphs of bounded twin-width
Applying Distal cutting lemma and Distal regularity lemma
results: Graphs of bounded twin-width have linear neighborhood complexity
Edge relation is distal in classes of ordered graphs of bounded twin-width
Obtained powerful combinatorial tools for graphs of bounded twin-width
title: Distal combinatorial tools for graphs of bounded twin-width
abstract: We study set systems formed by neighborhoods in graphs of bounded twin-width. We start by proving that such graphs have linear neighborhood complexity, in analogy to previous results concerning graphs from classes with bounded expansion and of bounded clique-width. Next, we shift our attention to the notions of distality and abstract cell decomposition, which come from model theory. We give a direct combinatorial proof that the edge relation is distal in classes of ordered graphs of bounded twin-width. This allows us to apply Distal cutting lemma and Distal regularity lemma, so we obtain powerful combinatorial tools for graphs of bounded twin-width.
